entry.title: Combined summary - BIP171 - Mocked implementation, generated specs, live API and 16 clients libs
entry.summary: Stéphane Traumat has recently unveiled CERISE, an extensive project designed to aid developers in creating BIP171 compliant servers without having to worry about various parameters, security, and rest mechanics. The project includes a mocked server implementation, an API with four methods, and 16 client libraries compatible with a wide range of programming languages such as Java, PHP, C++, Rusty, and Ruby. The package also comprises specifications for the supported currency-pair tokens, currency-pair information, current exchange rate, and historical exchange rates. Traumat is currently working on a template project that will help developers build a BIP171 compliant server with ease, set to be completed by September. The project provides links to both the website and GitHub, allowing easy access to its components.
